item.title: Bags of leaves, 20th July

item.title: Missing street lights, 20th July
item.description:
In the last couple of weeks the lights have been removed from the two lamp posts closest to the Fox Hill end of Lansdowne Place, and, so far, have not been replaced. As a result, there is no lighting to aid or re-assure residents of Fox Hill and Tudor Road, who may wish to use at night what is a popular cut through from the Crystal Palace Triangle but may well feel unsafe when doing so. Could these two lights therefore be re-instated, please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Lansdowne Place, Upper Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 45 Dalston Lane – thick smoke from neglected backgarden, 20th July
item.description:
The garden and house at 45 Dalston Lane are in a terrible state, completely unkept and full of mess. They regularly light fires in the backyard, creating thick smoke that spreads into surrounding flats. We’re forced to keep our windows shut even in hot we
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dalston Lane, Hackney, London

item.title: More bin bags piling up, 20th July
item.description:
Again someone is leaving large quantities of rubbish on the ground near the tattoo parlour on Nuxley Road. In this summer heat, it is not hygienic. This is the third time I’ve reported a new issue at the same place this month, so it is clearly an issue that needs some enforcement action rather than just a clean up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Nuxley Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 20th July
item.description:
Fences, water butts, plants and other detritus put in this public space abutting our fence. Sightings of vermin in our garden. We are not able to access this space, from the alley because of overgrown plants. We observe the level of deposits on this area has increased recently, and we would like to have reasonable access as our neighbours do. Thanks very much for your attention in this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Webb Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
